TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed GL extends System.Object

Docs.summary: OpenGL bindings for .NET, implementing the full OpenGL API, including extensions.

remarks.para: This class contains all OpenGL enums and functions defined in the latest OpenGL specification. The official .spec files can be found at: http://opengl.org/registry/.
A valid OpenGL context must be created before calling any OpenGL function.

Use the GL.Load and GL.LoadAll methods to prepare function entry points prior to use. To maintain cross-platform compatibility, this must be done for both core and extension functions. The GameWindow and the GLControl class will take care of this automatically.

You can use the GL.SupportsExtension method to check whether any given category of extension functions exists in the current OpenGL context. Keep in mind that different OpenGL contexts may support different extensions, and under different entry points. Always check if all required extensions are still supported when changing visuals or pixel formats.
You may retrieve the entry point for an OpenGL function using the GL.GetDelegate method.

.method public static hidebysig void Accum(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.AccumOp op, float32 value) cil managed

param.name: op
param.para: Specifies the accumulation buffer operation. Symbolic constants GL_ACCUM, GL_LOAD, GL_ADD, GL_MULT, and GL_RETURN are accepted.

param.name: value
param.para: Specifies a floating-point value used in the accumulation buffer operation. op determines how value is used.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0][deprecated: v3.1] Operate on the accumulation buffer

MemberSignature.Value: public static void ActiveTexture (MonoMac.OpenGL.TextureUnit texture);
.method public static hidebysig void ActiveTexture(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.TextureUnit texture) cil managed

param.name: texture
param.para: Specifies which texture unit to make active. The number of texture units is implementation dependent, but must be at least two. texture must be one of GL_TEXTUREi, where i ranges from 0 (GL_MAX_COMBINED_TEXTURE_IMAGE_UNITS - 1). The initial value is GL_TEXTURE0.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.3] Select active texture unit

MemberSignature.Value: public static void AlphaFunc (MonoMac.OpenGL.AlphaFunction func, float ref);
.method public static hidebysig void AlphaFunc(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.AlphaFunction func, float32 ref) cil managed

param.name: func
param.para: Specifies the alpha comparison function. Symbolic constants GL_NEVER, GL_LESS, GL_EQUAL, GL_LEQUAL, GL_GREATER, GL_NOTEQUAL, GL_GEQUAL, and GL_ALWAYS are accepted. The initial value is GL_ALWAYS.

param.name: ref
param.para: Specifies the reference value that incoming alpha values are compared to. This value is clamped to the range [0,1], where 0 represents the lowest possible alpha value and 1 the highest possible value. The initial reference value is 0.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0][deprecated: v3.1] Specify the alpha test function

MemberSignature.Value: public static void Begin (MonoMac.OpenGL.BeginMode mode);
.method public static hidebysig void Begin(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.BeginMode mode) cil managed

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies the primitive or primitives that will be created from vertices presented between glBegin and the subsequent glEnd. Ten symbolic constants are accepted: GL_POINTS, GL_LINES, GL_LINE_STRIP, GL_LINE_LOOP, GL_TRIANGLES, GL_TRIANGLE_STRIP, GL_TRIANGLE_FAN, GL_QUADS, GL_QUAD_STRIP, and GL_POLYGON.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0][deprecated: v3.1] Delimit the vertices of a primitive or a group of like primitives

param.name: mode

MemberSignature.Value: public static void BlendEquationSeparate (MonoMac.OpenGL.BlendEquationMode modeRGB, MonoMac.OpenGL.BlendEquationMode modeAlpha);
.method public static hidebysig void BlendEquationSeparate(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.BlendEquationMode modeRGB, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.BlendEquationMode modeAlpha) cil managed

param.name: modeRGB
param.para: specifies the RGB blend equation, how the red, green, and blue components of the source and destination colors are combined. It must be GL_FUNC_ADD, GL_FUNC_SUBTRACT, GL_FUNC_REVERSE_SUBTRACT, GL_MIN, GL_MAX.

param.name: modeAlpha
param.para: specifies the alpha blend equation, how the alpha component of the source and destination colors are combined. It must be GL_FUNC_ADD, GL_FUNC_SUBTRACT, GL_FUNC_REVERSE_SUBTRACT, GL_MIN, GL_MAX.

Docs.summary: [requires: v2.0] Set the RGB blend equation and the alpha blend equation separately

MemberSignature.Value: public static void BlendFunc (MonoMac.OpenGL.BlendingFactorSrc sfactor, MonoMac.OpenGL.BlendingFactorDest dfactor);
.method public static hidebysig void BlendFunc(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.BlendingFactorSrc sfactor, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.BlendingFactorDest dfactor) cil managed

param.name: sfactor
param.para: Specifies how the red, green, blue, and alpha source blending factors are computed. The initial value is GL_ONE.

param.name: dfactor
param.para: Specifies how the red, green, blue, and alpha destination blending factors are computed. The following symbolic constants are accepted: GL_ZERO, GL_ONE, GL_SRC_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR, GL_DST_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_COLOR, GL_SRC_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA, GL_DST_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_ALPHA. GL_CONSTANT_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_COLOR, GL_CONSTANT_ALPHA, and GL_ONE_MINUS_CONSTANT_ALPHA. The initial value is GL_ZERO.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0] Specify pixel arithmetic

MemberSignature.Value: public static void BufferData (MonoMac.OpenGL.BufferTarget target, IntPtr size, IntPtr data, MonoMac.OpenGL.BufferUsageHint usage);
.method public static hidebysig void BufferData(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.BufferTarget target, native int size, native int data, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.BufferUsageHint usage) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target buffer object. The symbolic constant must be GL_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_COPY_READ_BUFFER, GL_COPY_WRITE_BUFFER, GL_ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_PIXEL_PACK_BUFFER, GL_PIXEL_UNPACK_BUFFER, GL_TEXTURE_BUFFER, GL_TRANSFORM_FEEDBACK_BUFFER, or GL_UNIFORM_BUFFER.

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the size in bytes of the buffer object's new data store.

param.name: data
param.para: Specifies a pointer to data that will be copied into the data store for initialization, or NULL if no data is to be copied.

param.name: usage
param.para: Specifies the expected usage pattern of the data store. The symbolic constant must be GL_STREAM_DRAW, GL_STREAM_READ, GL_STREAM_COPY, GL_STATIC_DRAW, GL_STATIC_READ, GL_STATIC_COPY, GL_DYNAMIC_DRAW, GL_DYNAMIC_READ, or GL_DYNAMIC_COPY.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.5] Creates and initializes a buffer object's data store

.method public static hidebysig void BufferSubData<struct .ctor (class System.ValueType) T3>(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.BufferTarget target, native int offset, native int size, !!T3[,,] data) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target buffer object. The symbolic constant must be GL_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_COPY_READ_BUFFER, GL_COPY_WRITE_BUFFER, GL_ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_PIXEL_PACK_BUFFER, GL_PIXEL_UNPACK_BUFFER, GL_TEXTURE_BUFFER, GL_TRANSFORM_FEEDBACK_BUFFER, or GL_UNIFORM_BUFFER.

param.name: offset
param.para: Specifies the offset into the buffer object's data store where data replacement will begin, measured in bytes.

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the size in bytes of the data store region being replaced.

param.name: data
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the new data that will be copied into the data store.

param.name: texture
param.para: Specifies which texture unit to make active. The number of texture units is implementation dependent, but must be at least two. texture must be one of GL_TEXTURE, where i ranges from 0 to the value of GL_MAX_TEXTURE_COORDS - 1, which is an implementation-dependent value. The initial value is GL_TEXTURE0.

param.name: plane

MemberSignature.Value: public static void ColorMaterial (MonoMac.OpenGL.MaterialFace face, MonoMac.OpenGL.ColorMaterialParameter mode);
.method public static hidebysig void ColorMaterial(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.MaterialFace face, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.ColorMaterialParameter mode) cil managed

param.name: face
param.para: Specifies whether front, back, or both front and back material parameters should track the current color. Accepted values are GL_FRONT, GL_BACK, and GL_FRONT_AND_BACK. The initial value is GL_FRONT_AND_BACK.

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies which of several material parameters track the current color. Accepted values are GL_EMISSION, GL_AMBIENT, GL_DIFFUSE, GL_SPECULAR, and GL_AMBIENT_AND_DIFFUSE. The initial value is GL_AMBIENT_AND_DIFFUSE.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0][deprecated: v3.1] Cause a material color to track the current color

MemberSignature.Value: public static void ColorPointer (int size, MonoMac.OpenGL.ColorPointerType type, int stride, IntPtr pointer);
.method public static hidebysig void ColorPointer(int32 size, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.ColorPointerType type, int32 stride, native int pointer) cil managed

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the number of components per color. Must be 3 or 4. The initial value is 4.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each color component in the array. Symbolic constants GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_FLOAT, and GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive colors. If stride is 0, the colors are understood to be tightly packed in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first component of the first color element in the array. The initial value is 0.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.1][deprecated: v3.1] Define an array of colors

MemberSignature.Value: public static void ColorSubTable (MonoMac.OpenGL.ColorTableTarget target, int start, int count, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelFormat format, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelType type, IntPtr data);

.method public static hidebysig void ColorSubTable(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.ColorTableTarget target, int32 start, int32 count, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelFormat format, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelType type, native int data) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: Must be one of GL_COLOR_TABLE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_COLOR_TABLE, or GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_COLOR_TABLE.

param.name: start
param.para: The starting index of the portion of the color table to be replaced.

param.name: count
param.para: The number of table entries to replace.

param.name: format
param.para: The format of the pixel data in data. The allowable values are GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, and GL_BGRA.

param.name: type
param.para: The type of the pixel data in data. The allowable values are GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV.

param.name: data
param.para: Pointer to a one-dimensional array of pixel data that is processed to replace the specified region of the color table.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.2][deprecated: v3.1] Respecify a portion of a color table

MemberSignature.Value: public static void ColorTable (MonoMac.OpenGL.ColorTableTarget target, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat internalformat, int width, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelFormat format, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelType type, IntPtr table);

.method public static hidebysig void ColorTable(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.ColorTableTarget target, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat internalformat, int32 width, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelFormat format, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelType type, native int table) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: Must be one of GL_COLOR_TABLE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_COLOR_TABLE, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_COLOR_TABLE, GL_PROXY_COLOR_TABLE, GL_PROXY_POST_CONVOLUTION_COLOR_TABLE, or GL_PROXY_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_COLOR_TABLE.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: The internal format of the color table. The allowable values are GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_INTENSITY, GL_INTENSITY4, GL_INTENSITY8, GL_INTENSITY12, GL_INTENSITY16, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, and GL_RGBA16.

param.name: width
param.para: The number of entries in the color lookup table specified by data.

param.name: format
param.para: The format of the pixel data in data. The allowable values are GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, and GL_BGRA.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void CompressedTexImage1D (MonoMac.OpenGL.TextureTarget target, int level, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat internalformat, int width, int border, int imageSize, IntPtr data);

.method public static hidebysig void CompressedTexImage1D(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.TextureTarget target, int32 level, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat internalformat, int32 width, int32 border, int32 imageSize, native int data) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target texture. Must be GL_TEXTURE_1D or GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_1D.

param.name: level
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number. Level 0 is the base image level. Level n is the nth mipmap reduction image.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: Specifies the format of the compressed image data stored at address data.

param.name: width
param.para: Specifies the width of the texture image. All implementations support texture images that are at least 64 texels wide. The height of the 1D texture image is 1.

param.name: border
param.para: This value must be 0.

param.name: imageSize
param.para: Specifies the number of unsigned bytes of image data starting at the address specified by data.

param.name: data
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the compressed image data in memory.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.3] Specify a one-dimensional texture image in a compressed format

.method public static hidebysig void ConvolutionFilter1D(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.ConvolutionTarget target, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat internalformat, int32 width, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelFormat format, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelType type, native int image) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: Must be GL_CONVOLUTION_1D.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: The internal format of the convolution filter kernel. The allowable values are GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_INTENSITY, GL_INTENSITY4, GL_INTENSITY8, GL_INTENSITY12, GL_INTENSITY16, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, or GL_RGBA16.

param.name: width
param.para: The width of the pixel array referenced by data.

param.name: format
param.para: The format of the pixel data in data. The allowable values are GL_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_INTENSITY, GL_RGB, and GL_RGBA.

param.name: type
param.para: The type of the pixel data in data. Symbolic constants GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV are accepted.

param.name: target

MemberSignature.Value: public static void CopyColorTable (MonoMac.OpenGL.ColorTableTarget target, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat internalformat, int x, int y, int width);

.method public static hidebysig void CopyColorTable(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.ColorTableTarget target, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat internalformat, int32 x, int32 y, int32 width) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: The color table target. Must be GL_COLOR_TABLE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_COLOR_TABLE, or GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_COLOR_TABLE.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: The internal storage format of the texture image. Must be one of the following symbolic constants: GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_INTENSITY, GL_INTENSITY4, GL_INTENSITY8, GL_INTENSITY12, GL_INTENSITY16, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, or GL_RGBA16.

param.name: x
param.para: The x coordinate of the lower-left corner of the pixel rectangle to be transferred to the color table.

param.name: y
param.para: The y coordinate of the lower-left corner of the pixel rectangle to be transferred to the color table.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void CopyTexImage1D (MonoMac.OpenGL.TextureTarget target, int level, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat internalformat, int x, int y, int width, int border);

.method public static hidebysig void CopyTexImage1D(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.TextureTarget target, int32 level, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat internalformat, int32 x, int32 y, int32 width, int32 border) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target texture. Must be GL_TEXTURE_1D.

param.name: level
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number. Level 0 is the base image level. Level n is the nth mipmap reduction image.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: Specifies the internal format of the texture. Must be one of the following symbolic constants: GL_COMPRESSED_RED, GL_COMPRESSED_RG, GL_COMPRESSED_RGB, GL_COMPRESSED_RGBA. GL_COMPRESSED_SRGB, GL_COMPRESSED_SRGB_ALPHA. GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT16, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT24, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT32, GL_RED, GL_RG, GL_RGB, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, GL_RGBA16, GL_SRGB, GL_SRGB8, GL_SRGB_ALPHA, or GL_SRGB8_ALPHA8.

param.name: x
param.para: Specify the window coordinates of the left corner of the row of pixels to be copied.

param.name: width
param.para: Specifies the width of the texture image. Must be 0 or 2 sup n + 2 ( border ) for some integer . The height of the texture image is 1.

param.name: border
param.para: Specifies the width of the border. Must be either 0 or 1.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.1] Copy pixels into a 1D texture image

MemberSignature.Value: public static void DrawBuffer (MonoMac.OpenGL.DrawBufferMode mode);
.method public static hidebysig void DrawBuffer(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.DrawBufferMode mode) cil managed

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies up to four color buffers to be drawn into. Symbolic constants GL_NONE, GL_FRONT_LEFT, GL_FRONT_RIGHT, GL_BACK_LEFT, GL_BACK_RIGHT, GL_FRONT, GL_BACK, GL_LEFT, GL_RIGHT, and GL_FRONT_AND_BACK are accepted. The initial value is GL_FRONT for single-buffered contexts, and GL_BACK for double-buffered contexts.

.method public static hidebysig void DrawPixels(int32 width, int32 height, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelFormat format, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelType type, native int pixels) cil managed

param.name: width
param.para: Specify the dimensions of the pixel rectangle to be written into the frame buffer.

param.name: format
param.para: Specifies the format of the pixel data. Symbolic constants GL_COLOR_INDEX, GL_STENCIL_INDEX, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE, and GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA are accepted.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type for data. Symbolic constants GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV are accepted.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0][deprecated: v3.1] Write a block of pixels to the frame buffer

MemberSignature.Value: public static void FogCoordPointer (MonoMac.OpenGL.FogPointerType type, int stride, IntPtr pointer);
.method public static hidebysig void FogCoordPointer(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.FogPointerType type, int32 stride, native int pointer) cil managed

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each fog coordinate. Symbolic constants GL_FLOAT, or GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive fog coordinates. If stride is 0, the array elements are understood to be tightly packed. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first coordinate of the first fog coordinate in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: program
param.para: Specifies the program object to be queried.

param.name: index
param.para: Specifies the index of the attribute variable to be queried.

param.name: bufSize
param.para: Specifies the maximum number of characters OpenGL is allowed to write in the character buffer indicated by name.

param.name: length
param.para: Returns the number of characters actually written by OpenGL in the string indicated by name (excluding the null terminator) if a value other than NULL is passed.

param.name: size
param.para: Returns the size of the attribute variable.

param.name: type
param.para: Returns the data type of the attribute variable.

param.name: name
param.para: Returns a null terminated string containing the name of the attribute variable.

.method public static hidebysig void GetActiveUniform(int32 program, int32 index, int32 bufSize, int32 length, int32 size, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.ActiveUniformType type, class System.Text.StringBuilder name) cil managed

param.name: program
param.para: Specifies the program object to be queried.

param.name: index
param.para: Specifies the index of the uniform variable to be queried.

param.name: bufSize
param.para: Specifies the maximum number of characters OpenGL is allowed to write in the character buffer indicated by name.

param.name: length
param.para: Returns the number of characters actually written by OpenGL in the string indicated by name (excluding the null terminator) if a value other than NULL is passed.

param.name: size
param.para: Returns the size of the uniform variable.

param.name: type
param.para: Returns the data type of the uniform variable.

param.name: name
param.para: Returns a null terminated string containing the name of the uniform variable.

Docs.summary: [requires: v2.0] Returns information about an active uniform variable for the specified program object

MemberSignature.Value: public static void GetClipPlane (MonoMac.OpenGL.ClipPlaneName plane, out double equation);
.method public static hidebysig void GetClipPlane(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.ClipPlaneName plane, float64 equation) cil managed

param.name: plane
param.para: Specifies a clipping plane. The number of clipping planes depends on the implementation, but at least six clipping planes are supported. They are identified by symbolic names of the form GL_CLIP_PLANE where i ranges from 0 to the value of GL_MAX_CLIP_PLANES - 1.

param.name: equation
param.para: Returns four double-precision values that are the coefficients of the plane equation of plane in eye coordinates. The initial value is (0, 0, 0, 0).

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0][deprecated: v3.1] Return the coefficients of the specified clipping plane

MemberSignature.Value: public static void GetColorTable (MonoMac.OpenGL.ColorTableTarget target, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelFormat format, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelType type, IntPtr table);

.method public static hidebysig void GetColorTable(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.ColorTableTarget target, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelFormat format, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelType type, native int table) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: Must be GL_COLOR_TABLE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_COLOR_TABLE, or GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_COLOR_TABLE.

param.name: format
param.para: The format of the pixel data in table. The possible values are GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, and GL_BGRA.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void GetHistogram (MonoMac.OpenGL.HistogramTarget target, bool reset, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelFormat format, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelType type, IntPtr values);

.method public static hidebysig void GetHistogram(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.HistogramTarget target, bool reset, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelFormat format, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelType type, native int values) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: Must be GL_HISTOGRAM.

param.name: reset
param.para: If GL_TRUE, each component counter that is actually returned is reset to zero. (Other counters are unaffected.) If GL_FALSE, none of the counters in the histogram table is modified.

param.name: format
param.para: The format of values to be returned in values. Must be one of GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_LUMINANCE, or GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA.

param.name: type
param.para: The type of values to be returned in values. Symbolic constants GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV are accepted.

param.name: values
param.para: A pointer to storage for the returned histogram table.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.2][deprecated: v3.1] Get histogram table

MemberSignature.Value: public static void GetLight (MonoMac.OpenGL.LightName light, MonoMac.OpenGL.LightParameter pname, out int params);
.method public static hidebysig void GetLight(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.LightName light, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.LightParameter pname, int32 params) cil managed

param.name: light
param.para: Specifies a light source. The number of possible lights depends on the implementation, but at least eight lights are supported. They are identified by symbolic names of the form GL_LIGHT where ranges from 0 to the value of GL_MAX_LIGHTS - 1.

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies a light source parameter for light. Accepted symbolic names are GL_AMBIENT, GL_DIFFUSE, GL_SPECULAR, GL_POSITION, GL_SPOT_DIRECTION, GL_SPOT_EXPONENT, GL_SPOT_CUTOFF, GL_CONSTANT_ATTENUATION, GL_LINEAR_ATTENUATION, and GL_QUADRATIC_ATTENUATION.

param.name: params
param.para: Returns the requested data.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0][deprecated: v3.1] Return light source parameter values

MemberSignature.Value: public static void GetMinmax (MonoMac.OpenGL.MinmaxTarget target, bool reset, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelFormat format, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelType type, IntPtr values);

.method public static hidebysig void GetMinmax(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.MinmaxTarget target, bool reset, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelFormat format, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelType type, native int values) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: Must be GL_MINMAX.

param.name: reset
param.para: If GL_TRUE, all entries in the minmax table that are actually returned are reset to their initial values. (Other entries are unaltered.) If GL_FALSE, the minmax table is unaltered.

param.name: format
param.para: The format of the data to be returned in values. Must be one of GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_LUMINANCE, or GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA.

param.name: values
param.para: A pointer to storage for the returned values.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.2][deprecated: v3.1] Get minimum and maximum pixel values

MemberSignature.Value: public static void GetSeparableFilter (MonoMac.OpenGL.SeparableTarget target, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelFormat format, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelType type, IntPtr row, IntPtr column, IntPtr span);

.method public static hidebysig void GetSeparableFilter(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.SeparableTarget target, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelFormat format, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelType type, native int row, native int column, native int span) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: The separable filter to be retrieved. Must be GL_SEPARABLE_2D.

param.name: format
param.para: Format of the output images. Must be one of GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_LUMINANCE, or GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA.

param.name: type
param.para: Data type of components in the output images. Symbolic constants GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV are accepted.

param.name: row
param.para: Pointer to storage for the row filter image.

param.name: column
param.para: Pointer to storage for the column filter image.

param.name: span
param.para: Pointer to storage for the span filter image (currently unused).

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.2][deprecated: v3.1] Get separable convolution filter kernel images

param.para: Returns the requested data.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void GetTexImage (MonoMac.OpenGL.TextureTarget target, int level, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelFormat format, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelType type, IntPtr pixels);

.method public static hidebysig void GetTexImage(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.TextureTarget target, int32 level, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelFormat format, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelType type, native int pixels) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies which texture is to be obtained. GL_TEXTURE_1D, GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_3D, GL_TEXTURE_1D_ARRAY, GL_TEXTURE_2D_ARRAY, GL_TEXTURE_RECTANGLE, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Z, and GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Z are accepted.

param.name: level
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number of the desired image. Level 0 is the base image level. Level is the th mipmap reduction image.

param.name: format
param.para: Specifies a pixel format for the returned data. The supported formats are GL_STENCIL_INDEX, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT, GL_DEPTH_STENCIL, GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_RG, GL_RGB, GL_RGBA, GL_BGR, GL_BGRA, GL_RED_INTEGER, GL_GREEN_INTEGER, GL_BLUE_INTEGER, GL_RG_INTEGER, GL_RGB_INTEGER, GL_RGBA_INTEGER, GL_BGR_INTEGER, GL_BGRA_INTEGER.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies a pixel type for the returned data. The supported types are GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_HALF_FLOAT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_24_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10F_11F_11F_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_5_9_9_9_REV, and GL_FLOAT_32_UNSIGNED_INT_24_8_REV.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0] Return a texture image

The supported formats are GL_STENCIL_INDEX, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT, GL_DEPTH_STENCIL, GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_RG, GL_RGB, GL_RGBA, GL_BGR, GL_BGRA, GL_RED_INTEGER, GL_GREEN_INTEGER, GL_BLUE_INTEGER, GL_RG_INTEGER, GL_RGB_INTEGER, GL_RGBA_INTEGER, GL_BGR_INTEGER, GL_BGRA_INTEGER.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies a pixel type for the returned data. The supported types are GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_HALF_FLOAT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_24_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10F_11F_11F_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_5_9_9_9_REV, and GL_FLOAT_32_UNSIGNED_INT_24_8_REV.

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of the target texture, one of GL_TEXTURE_1D, GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_3D, GL_TEXTURE_1D_ARRAY, GL_TEXTURE_2D_ARRAY, GL_TEXTURE_RECTANGLE, GL_TEXTURE_2D_MULTISAMPLE, GL_TEXTURE_2D_MULTISAMPLE_ARRAY, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_X, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Y, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_POSITIVE_Z, GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP_NEGATIVE_Z, GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_1D, GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_2D, GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_3D, GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_1D_ARRAY, GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_2D_ARRAY, GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_RECTANGLE, GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_2D_MULTISAMPLE, GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_2D_MULTISAMPLE_ARRAY, GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP, or GL_TEXTURE_BUFFER.

GL_TEXTURE_WIDTH, GL_TEXTURE_HEIGHT, GL_TEXTURE_DEPTH, GL_TEXTURE_INTERNAL_FORMAT, GL_TEXTURE_BORDER, GL_TEXTURE_RED_SIZE, GL_TEXTURE_GREEN_SIZE, GL_TEXTURE_BLUE_SIZE, GL_TEXTURE_ALPHA_SIZE, GL_TEXTURE_DEPTH_SIZE, GL_TEXTURE_COMPRESSED, and GL_TEXTURE_COMPRESSED_IMAGE_SIZE are accepted.

param.name: params
param.para: Returns the requested data.

.method public static hidebysig void Hint(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.HintTarget target, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.HintMode mode) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies a symbolic constant indicating the behavior to be controlled. GL_LINE_SMOOTH_HINT, GL_POLYGON_SMOOTH_HINT, GL_TEXTURE_COMPRESSION_HINT, and GL_FRAGMENT_SHADER_DERIVATIVE_HINT are accepted.

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies a symbolic constant indicating the desired behavior. GL_FASTEST, GL_NICEST, and GL_DONT_CARE are accepted.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0] Specify implementation-specific hints

MemberSignature.Value: public static void Histogram (MonoMac.OpenGL.HistogramTarget target, int width, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat internalformat, bool sink);
.method public static hidebysig void Histogram(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.HistogramTarget target, int32 width, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat internalformat, bool sink) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: The histogram whose parameters are to be set. Must be one of GL_HISTOGRAM or GL_PROXY_HISTOGRAM.

param.name: width
param.para: The number of entries in the histogram table. Must be a power of 2.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: The format of entries in the histogram table. Must be one of GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, or GL_RGBA16.

param.name: sink
param.para: If GL_TRUE, pixels will be consumed by the histogramming process and no drawing or texture loading will take place. If GL_FALSE, pixels will proceed to the minmax process after histogramming.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.2][deprecated: v3.1] Define histogram table

.method public static hidebysig void IndexPointer(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.IndexPointerType type, int32 stride, native int pointer) cil managed

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each color index in the array. Symbolic constants GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, and GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive color indexes. If stride is 0, the color indexes are understood to be tightly packed in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first index in the array. The initial value is 0.

.method public static hidebysig void Light(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.LightName light, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.LightParameter pname, int32 param) cil managed

param.name: light
param.para: Specifies a light. The number of lights depends on the implementation, but at least eight lights are supported. They are identified by symbolic names of the form GL_LIGHT , where i ranges from 0 to the value of GL_MAX_LIGHTS - 1.

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies a single-valued light source parameter for light. GL_SPOT_EXPONENT, GL_SPOT_CUTOFF, GL_CONSTANT_ATTENUATION, GL_LINEAR_ATTENUATION, and GL_QUADRATIC_ATTENUATION are accepted.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies the value that parameter pname of light source light will be set to.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void LineStipple (int factor, short pattern);
.method public static hidebysig void LineStipple(int32 factor, int16 pattern) cil managed

param.name: factor
param.para: Specifies a multiplier for each bit in the line stipple pattern. If factor is 3, for example, each bit in the pattern is used three times before the next bit in the pattern is used. factor is clamped to the range [1, 256] and defaults to 1.

param.name: pattern
param.para: Specifies a 16-bit integer whose bit pattern determines which fragments of a line will be drawn when the line is rasterized. Bit zero is used first; the default pattern is all 1's.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0][deprecated: v3.1] Specify the line stipple pattern

param.name: factor
param.para: Specifies a multiplier for each bit in the line stipple pattern. If factor is 3, for example, each bit in the pattern is used three times before the next bit in the pattern is used. factor is clamped to the range [1, 256] and defaults to 1.

param.name: pattern
param.para: Specifies a 16-bit integer whose bit pattern determines which fragments of a line will be drawn when the line is rasterized. Bit zero is used first; the default pattern is all 1's.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0][deprecated: v3.1] Specify the line stipple pattern

MemberSignature.Value: public static void LogicOp (MonoMac.OpenGL.LogicOp opcode);
.method public static hidebysig void LogicOp(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.LogicOp opcode) cil managed

param.name: opcode
param.para: Specifies a symbolic constant that selects a logical operation. The following symbols are accepted: GL_CLEAR, GL_SET, GL_COPY, GL_COPY_INVERTED, GL_NOOP, GL_INVERT, GL_AND, GL_NAND, GL_OR, GL_NOR, GL_XOR, GL_EQUIV, GL_AND_REVERSE, GL_AND_INVERTED, GL_OR_REVERSE, and GL_OR_INVERTED. The initial value is GL_COPY.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0] Specify a logical pixel operation for rendering

MemberSignature.Value: public static void Map1 (MonoMac.OpenGL.MapTarget target, double u1, double u2, int stride, int order, ref double points);
.method public static hidebysig void Map1(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.MapTarget target, float64 u1, float64 u2, int32 stride, int32 order, float64 points) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the kind of values that are generated by the evaluator. Symbolic constants GL_MAP1_VERTEX_3, GL_MAP1_VERTEX_4, GL_MAP1_INDEX, GL_MAP1_COLOR_4, GL_MAP1_NORMAL, GL_MAP1_TEXTURE_COORD_1, GL_MAP1_TEXTURE_COORD_2, GL_MAP1_TEXTURE_COORD_3, and GL_MAP1_TEXTURE_COORD_4 are accepted.

param.name: u1
param.para: Specify a linear mapping of , as presented to glEvalCoord1, to u hat, the variable that is evaluated by the equations specified by this command.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the number of floats or doubles between the beginning of one control point and the beginning of the next one in the data structure referenced in points. This allows control points to be embedded in arbitrary data structures. The only constraint is that the values for a particular control point must occupy contiguous memory locations.

param.name: order
param.para: Specifies the number of control points. Must be positive.

param.name: points
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the array of control points.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0][deprecated: v3.1] Define a one-dimensional evaluator

MemberSignature.Value: public static void Map2 (MonoMac.OpenGL.MapTarget target, double u1, double u2, int ustride, int uorder, double v1, double v2, int vstride, int vorder, ref double points);

.method public static hidebysig void Map2(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.MapTarget target, float64 u1, float64 u2, int32 ustride, int32 uorder, float64 v1, float64 v2, int32 vstride, int32 vorder, float64 points) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the kind of values that are generated by the evaluator. Symbolic constants GL_MAP2_VERTEX_3, GL_MAP2_VERTEX_4, GL_MAP2_INDEX, GL_MAP2_COLOR_4, GL_MAP2_NORMAL, GL_MAP2_TEXTURE_COORD_1, GL_MAP2_TEXTURE_COORD_2, GL_MAP2_TEXTURE_COORD_3, and GL_MAP2_TEXTURE_COORD_4 are accepted.

param.name: u1
param.para: Specify a linear mapping of , as presented to glEvalCoord2, to u hat, one of the two variables that are evaluated by the equations specified by this command. Initially, u1 is 0 and u2 is 1.

param.name: ustride
param.para: Specifies the number of floats or doubles between the beginning of control point R sub ij and the beginning of control point R sub { (i+1) j }, where and are the and control point indices, respectively. This allows control points to be embedded in arbitrary data structures. The only constraint is that the values for a particular control point must occupy contiguous memory locations. The initial value of ustride is 0.

param.name: uorder
param.para: Specifies the dimension of the control point array in the axis. Must be positive. The initial value is 1.

param.name: v1
param.para: Specify a linear mapping of , as presented to glEvalCoord2, to v hat, one of the two variables that are evaluated by the equations specified by this command. Initially, v1 is 0 and v2 is 1.

param.name: vstride
param.para: Specifies the number of floats or doubles between the beginning of control point R sub ij and the beginning of control point R sub { i (j+1) }, where and are the and control point indices, respectively. This allows control points to be embedded in arbitrary data structures. The only constraint is that the values for a particular control point must occupy contiguous memory locations. The initial value of vstride is 0.

param.name: vorder
param.para: Specifies the dimension of the control point array in the axis. Must be positive. The initial value is 1.

param.name: points
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the array of control points.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0][deprecated: v3.1] Define a two-dimensional evaluator

.method public static hidebysig void Map2(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.MapTarget target, float32 u1, float32 u2, int32 ustride, int32 uorder, float32 v1, float32 v2, int32 vstride, int32 vorder, float32* points) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the kind of values that are generated by the evaluator. Symbolic constants GL_MAP2_VERTEX_3, GL_MAP2_VERTEX_4, GL_MAP2_INDEX, GL_MAP2_COLOR_4, GL_MAP2_NORMAL, GL_MAP2_TEXTURE_COORD_1, GL_MAP2_TEXTURE_COORD_2, GL_MAP2_TEXTURE_COORD_3, and GL_MAP2_TEXTURE_COORD_4 are accepted.

param.name: u1
param.para: Specify a linear mapping of , as presented to glEvalCoord2, to u hat, one of the two variables that are evaluated by the equations specified by this command. Initially, u1 is 0 and u2 is 1.

param.name: ustride
param.para: Specifies the number of floats or doubles between the beginning of control point R sub ij and the beginning of control point R sub { (i+1) j }, where and are the and control point indices, respectively. This allows control points to be embedded in arbitrary data structures. The only constraint is that the values for a particular control point must occupy contiguous memory locations. The initial value of ustride is 0.

param.name: uorder
param.para: Specifies the dimension of the control point array in the axis. Must be positive. The initial value is 1.

param.name: v1
param.para: Specify a linear mapping of , as presented to glEvalCoord2, to v hat, one of the two variables that are evaluated by the equations specified by this command. Initially, v1 is 0 and v2 is 1.

param.name: vstride
param.para: Specifies the number of floats or doubles between the beginning of control point R sub ij and the beginning of control point R sub { i (j+1) }, where and are the and control point indices, respectively. This allows control points to be embedded in arbitrary data structures. The only constraint is that the values for a particular control point must occupy contiguous memory locations. The initial value of vstride is 0.

param.name: vorder
param.para: Specifies the dimension of the control point array in the axis. Must be positive. The initial value is 1.

param.name: points
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the array of control points.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0][deprecated: v3.1] Define a two-dimensional evaluator

MemberSignature.Value: public static IntPtr MapBuffer (MonoMac.OpenGL.BufferTarget target, MonoMac.OpenGL.BufferAccess access);
.method public static hidebysig native int MapBuffer(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.BufferTarget target, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.BufferAccess access) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target buffer object being mapped. The symbolic constant must be GL_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_COPY_READ_BUFFER, GL_COPY_WRITE_BUFFER, GL_ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER, GL_PIXEL_PACK_BUFFER, GL_PIXEL_UNPACK_BUFFER, GL_TEXTURE_BUFFER, GL_TRANSFORM_FEEDBACK_BUFFER or GL_UNIFORM_BUFFER.

param.name: access
param.para: Specifies the access policy, indicating whether it will be possible to read from, write to, or both read from and write to the buffer object's mapped data store. The symbolic constant must be GL_READ_ONLY, GL_WRITE_ONLY, or GL_READ_WRITE.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.5] Map a buffer object's data store

MemberSignature.Value: public static void MatrixMode (MonoMac.OpenGL.MatrixMode mode);
.method public static hidebysig void MatrixMode(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.MatrixMode mode) cil managed

param.name: mode
param.para: Specifies which matrix stack is the target for subsequent matrix operations. Three values are accepted: GL_MODELVIEW, GL_PROJECTION, and GL_TEXTURE. The initial value is GL_MODELVIEW. Additionally, if the ARB_imaging extension is supported, GL_COLOR is also accepted.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0][deprecated: v3.1] Specify which matrix is the current matrix

MemberSignature.Value: public static void Minmax (MonoMac.OpenGL.MinmaxTarget target, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat internalformat, bool sink);
.method public static hidebysig void Minmax(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.MinmaxTarget target, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat internalformat, bool sink) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: The minmax table whose parameters are to be set. Must be GL_MINMAX.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: The format of entries in the minmax table. Must be one of GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, or GL_RGBA16.

param.name: sink
param.para: If GL_TRUE, pixels will be consumed by the minmax process and no drawing or texture loading will take place. If GL_FALSE, pixels will proceed to the final conversion process after minmax.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.2][deprecated: v3.1] Define minmax table

MemberSignature.Value: public static void MultiTexCoord1 (MonoMac.OpenGL.TextureUnit target, double s);
.method public static hidebysig void MultiTexCoord1(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.TextureUnit target, float64 s) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the texture unit whose coordinates should be modified. The number of texture units is implementation dependent, but must be at least two. Symbolic constant must be one of GL_TEXTURE, where i ranges from 0 to GL_MAX_TEXTURE_COORDS - 1, which is an implementation-dependent value.

param.name: s
param.para: Specify s, t, r, and q texture coordinates for target texture unit. Not all parameters are present in all forms of the command.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.3][deprecated: v3.1] Set the current texture coordinates

MemberSignature.Value: public static void NormalPointer (MonoMac.OpenGL.NormalPointerType type, int stride, IntPtr pointer);
.method public static hidebysig void NormalPointer(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.NormalPointerType type, int32 stride, native int pointer) cil managed

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each coordinate in the array. Symbolic constants GL_BYTE, GL_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, and GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive normals. If stride is 0, the normals are understood to be tightly packed in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first coordinate of the first normal in the array. The initial value is 0.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.1][deprecated: v3.1] Define an array of normals

MemberSignature.Value: public static void PixelStore (MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelStoreParameter pname, int param);
.method public static hidebysig void PixelStore(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelStoreParameter pname, int32 param) cil managed

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of the parameter to be set. Six values affect the packing of pixel data into memory: GL_PACK_SWAP_BYTES, GL_PACK_LSB_FIRST, GL_PACK_ROW_LENGTH, GL_PACK_IMAGE_HEIGHT, GL_PACK_SKIP_PIXELS, GL_PACK_SKIP_ROWS, GL_PACK_SKIP_IMAGES, and GL_PACK_ALIGNMENT. Six more affect the unpacking of pixel data from memory: GL_UNPACK_SWAP_BYTES, GL_UNPACK_LSB_FIRST, GL_UNPACK_ROW_LENGTH, GL_UNPACK_IMAGE_HEIGHT, GL_UNPACK_SKIP_PIXELS, GL_UNPACK_SKIP_ROWS, GL_UNPACK_SKIP_IMAGES, and GL_UNPACK_ALIGNMENT.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies the value that pname is set to.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0] Set pixel storage modes

Six more affect the unpacking of pixel data from memory: GL_UNPACK_SWAP_BYTES, GL_UNPACK_LSB_FIRST, GL_UNPACK_ROW_LENGTH, GL_UNPACK_IMAGE_HEIGHT, GL_UNPACK_SKIP_PIXELS, GL_UNPACK_SKIP_ROWS, GL_UNPACK_SKIP_IMAGES, and GL_UNPACK_ALIGNMENT.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void PixelTransfer (MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelTransferParameter pname, int param);
.method public static hidebysig void PixelTransfer(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelTransferParameter pname, int32 param) cil managed

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of the pixel transfer parameter to be set. Must be one of the following: GL_MAP_COLOR, GL_MAP_STENCIL, GL_INDEX_SHIFT, GL_INDEX_OFFSET, GL_RED_SCALE, GL_RED_BIAS, GL_GREEN_SCALE, GL_GREEN_BIAS, GL_BLUE_SCALE, GL_BLUE_BIAS, GL_ALPHA_SCALE, GL_ALPHA_BIAS, GL_DEPTH_SCALE, or GL_DEPTH_BIAS.

Additionally, if the ARB_imaging extension is supported, the following symbolic names are accepted: GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_RED_SCALE, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_GREEN_SCALE, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_BLUE_SCALE, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_ALPHA_SCALE, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_RED_BIAS, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_GREEN_BIAS, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_BLUE_BIAS, GL_POST_COLOR_MATRIX_ALPHA_BIAS, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_RED_SCALE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_GREEN_SCALE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_BLUE_SCALE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_ALPHA_SCALE, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_RED_BIAS, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_GREEN_BIAS, GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_BLUE_BIAS, and GL_POST_CONVOLUTION_ALPHA_BIAS.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies the value that pname is set to.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0][deprecated: v3.1] Set pixel transfer modes

MemberSignature.Value: public static void ReadPixels (int x, int y, int width, int height, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelFormat format, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelType type, IntPtr pixels);

.method public static hidebysig void ReadPixels(int32 x, int32 y, int32 width, int32 height, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelFormat format, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelType type, native int pixels) cil managed

param.name: x
param.para: Specify the window coordinates of the first pixel that is read from the frame buffer. This location is the lower left corner of a rectangular block of pixels.

param.name: width
param.para: Specify the dimensions of the pixel rectangle. width and height of one correspond to a single pixel.

param.name: format
param.para: Specifies the format of the pixel data. The following symbolic values are accepted: GL_STENCIL_INDEX, GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT, GL_DEPTH_STENCIL, GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, and GL_BGRA.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of the pixel data. Must be one of GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_HALF_FLOAT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_24_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10F_11F_11F_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_5_9_9_9_REV, or GL_FLOAT_32_UNSIGNED_INT_24_8_REV.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0] Read a block of pixels from the frame buffer

MemberSignature.Value: public static void SecondaryColorPointer (int size, MonoMac.OpenGL.ColorPointerType type, int stride, IntPtr pointer);
.method public static hidebysig void SecondaryColorPointer(int32 size, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.ColorPointerType type, int32 stride, native int pointer) cil managed

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the number of components per color. Must be 3.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each color component in the array. Symbolic constants GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_FLOAT, or GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive colors. If stride is 0, the colors are understood to be tightly packed in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first component of the first color element in the array. The initial value is 0.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.4][deprecated: v3.1] Define an array of secondary colors

MemberSignature.Value: public static void SeparableFilter2D (MonoMac.OpenGL.SeparableTarget target, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat internalformat, int width, int height, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelFormat format, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelType type, IntPtr row, IntPtr column);

.method public static hidebysig void SeparableFilter2D(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.SeparableTarget target, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat internalformat, int32 width, int32 height, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelFormat format, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelType type, native int row, native int column) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: Must be GL_SEPARABLE_2D.

param.name: internalformat
param.para: The internal format of the convolution filter kernel. The allowable values are GL_ALPHA, GL_ALPHA4, GL_ALPHA8, GL_ALPHA12, GL_ALPHA16, GL_LUMINANCE, GL_LUMINANCE4, GL_LUMINANCE8, GL_LUMINANCE12, GL_LUMINANCE16, GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA, GL_LUMINANCE4_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE6_ALPHA2, GL_LUMINANCE8_ALPHA8, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA4, GL_LUMINANCE12_ALPHA12, GL_LUMINANCE16_ALPHA16, GL_INTENSITY, GL_INTENSITY4, GL_INTENSITY8, GL_INTENSITY12, GL_INTENSITY16, GL_R3_G3_B2, GL_RGB, GL_RGB4, GL_RGB5, GL_RGB8, GL_RGB10, GL_RGB12, GL_RGB16, GL_RGBA, GL_RGBA2, GL_RGBA4, GL_RGB5_A1, GL_RGBA8, GL_RGB10_A2, GL_RGBA12, or GL_RGBA16.

param.name: width
param.para: The number of elements in the pixel array referenced by row. (This is the width of the separable filter kernel.)

param.name: height
param.para: The number of elements in the pixel array referenced by column. (This is the height of the separable filter kernel.)

param.name: format
param.para: The format of the pixel data in row and column. The allowable values are GL_RED, GL_GREEN, GL_BLUE, GL_ALPHA, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, GL_BGRA, GL_INTENSITY, GL_LUMINANCE, and GL_LUMINANCE_ALPHA.

param.name: type
param.para: The type of the pixel data in row and column. Symbolic constants GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_BITMAP, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV are accepted.

param.name: row
param.para: Pointer to a one-dimensional array of pixel data that is processed to build the row filter kernel.

param.name: column
param.para: Pointer to a one-dimensional array of pixel data that is processed to build the column filter kernel.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.2][deprecated: v3.1] Define a separable two-dimensional convolution filter

MemberSignature.Value: public static void StencilFunc (MonoMac.OpenGL.StencilFunction func, int ref, int mask);
.method public static hidebysig void StencilFunc(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.StencilFunction func, int32 ref, int32 mask) cil managed

param.name: func
param.para: Specifies the test function. Eight symbolic constants are valid: GL_NEVER, GL_LESS, GL_LEQUAL, GL_GREATER, GL_GEQUAL, GL_EQUAL, GL_NOTEQUAL, and GL_ALWAYS. The initial value is GL_ALWAYS.

param.name: ref
param.para: Specifies the reference value for the stencil test. ref is clamped to the range [0, 2 sup n - 1], where is the number of bitplanes in the stencil buffer. The initial value is 0.

param.name: mask
param.para: Specifies a mask that is ANDed with both the reference value and the stored stencil value when the test is done. The initial value is all 1's.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0] Set front and back function and reference value for stencil testing

MemberSignature.Value: public static void StencilFunc (MonoMac.OpenGL.StencilFunction func, int ref, uint mask);

param.para: Specifies the test function. Eight symbolic constants are valid: GL_NEVER, GL_LESS, GL_LEQUAL, GL_GREATER, GL_GEQUAL, GL_EQUAL, GL_NOTEQUAL, and GL_ALWAYS. The initial value is GL_ALWAYS.

param.name: ref
param.para: Specifies the reference value for the stencil test. ref is clamped to the range [0, 2 sup n - 1], where is the number of bitplanes in the stencil buffer. The initial value is 0.

param.name: mask
param.para: Specifies a mask that is ANDed with both the reference value and the stored stencil value when the test is done. The initial value is all 1's.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0] Set front and back function and reference value for stencil testing

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0] Set front and back stencil test actions

MemberSignature.Value: public static void StencilOpSeparate (MonoMac.OpenGL.StencilFace face, MonoMac.OpenGL.StencilOp sfail, MonoMac.OpenGL.StencilOp dpfail, MonoMac.OpenGL.StencilOp dppass);

.method public static hidebysig void StencilOpSeparate(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.StencilFace face, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.StencilOp sfail, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.StencilOp dpfail, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.StencilOp dppass) cil managed

param.name: face
param.para: Specifies whether front and/or back stencil state is updated. Three symbolic constants are valid: GL_FRONT, GL_BACK, and GL_FRONT_AND_BACK.

param.name: sfail
param.para: Specifies the action to take when the stencil test fails. Eight symbolic constants are accepted: GL_KEEP, GL_ZERO, GL_REPLACE, GL_INCR, GL_INCR_WRAP, GL_DECR, GL_DECR_WRAP, and GL_INVERT. The initial value is GL_KEEP.

param.name: dpfail
param.para: Specifies the stencil action when the stencil test passes, but the depth test fails. dpfail accepts the same symbolic constants as sfail. The initial value is GL_KEEP.

param.name: dppass
param.para: Specifies the stencil action when both the stencil test and the depth test pass, or when the stencil test passes and either there is no depth buffer or depth testing is not enabled. dppass accepts the same symbolic constants as sfail. The initial value is GL_KEEP.

Docs.summary: [requires: v2.0] Set front and/or back stencil test actions

MemberSignature.Value: public static void TexCoordPointer (int size, MonoMac.OpenGL.TexCoordPointerType type, int stride, IntPtr pointer);
.method public static hidebysig void TexCoordPointer(int32 size, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.TexCoordPointerType type, int32 stride, native int pointer) cil managed

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the number of coordinates per array element. Must be 1, 2, 3, or 4. The initial value is 4.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each texture coordinate. Symbolic constants GL_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, or GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive texture coordinate sets. If stride is 0, the array elements are understood to be tightly packed. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first coordinate of the first texture coordinate set in the array. The initial value is 0.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.1][deprecated: v3.1] Define an array of texture coordinates

MemberSignature.Value: public static void TexEnv (MonoMac.OpenGL.TextureEnvTarget target, MonoMac.OpenGL.TextureEnvParameter pname, int param);
.method public static hidebysig void TexEnv(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.TextureEnvTarget target, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.TextureEnvParameter pname, int32 param) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies a texture environment. May be GL_TEXTURE_ENV, GL_TEXTURE_FILTER_CONTROL or GL_POINT_SPRITE.

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of a single-valued texture environment parameter. May be either GL_TEXTURE_ENV_MODE, GL_TEXTURE_LOD_BIAS, GL_COMBINE_RGB, GL_COMBINE_ALPHA, GL_SRC0_RGB, GL_SRC1_RGB, GL_SRC2_RGB, GL_SRC0_ALPHA, GL_SRC1_ALPHA, GL_SRC2_ALPHA, GL_OPERAND0_RGB, GL_OPERAND1_RGB, GL_OPERAND2_RGB, GL_OPERAND0_ALPHA, GL_OPERAND1_ALPHA, GL_OPERAND2_ALPHA, GL_RGB_SCALE, GL_ALPHA_SCALE, or GL_COORD_REPLACE.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies a single symbolic constant, one of GL_ADD, GL_ADD_SIGNED, GL_INTERPOLATE, GL_MODULATE, GL_DECAL, GL_BLEND, GL_REPLACE, GL_SUBTRACT, GL_COMBINE, GL_TEXTURE, GL_CONSTANT, GL_PRIMARY_COLOR, GL_PREVIOUS, GL_SRC_COLOR, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR, GL_SRC_ALPHA, GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA, a single boolean value for the point sprite texture coordinate replacement, a single floating-point value for the texture level-of-detail bias, or 1.0, 2.0, or 4.0 when specifying the GL_RGB_SCALE or GL_ALPHA_SCALE.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0][deprecated: v3.1] Set texture environment parameters

MemberSignature.Value: public static void TexImage1D (MonoMac.OpenGL.TextureTarget target, int level, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat internalformat, int width, int border, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelFormat format, MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelType type, IntPtr pixels);

.method public static hidebysig void TexImage1D(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.TextureTarget target, int32 level, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelInternalFormat internalformat, int32 width, int32 border, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelFormat format, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.PixelType type, native int pixels) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target texture. Must be GL_TEXTURE_1D or GL_PROXY_TEXTURE_1D.

param.name: level
param.para: Specifies the level-of-detail number. Level 0 is the base image level. Level n is the nth mipmap reduction image.

param.name: width
param.para: Specifies the width of the texture image. All implementations support texture images that are at least 1024 texels wide. The height of the 1D texture image is 1.

param.name: border
param.para: This value must be 0.

param.name: format
param.para: Specifies the format of the pixel data. The following symbolic values are accepted: GL_RED, GL_RG, GL_RGB, GL_BGR, GL_RGBA, and GL_BGRA.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of the pixel data. The following symbolic values are accepted: GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_INT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_3_3_2, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE_2_3_3_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_6_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_4_4_4_4_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_5_5_5_1, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT_1_5_5_5_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_8_8_8_8_REV, GL_UNSIGNED_INT_10_10_10_2, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.0] Specify a one-dimensional texture image

.method public static hidebysig void TexParameter(valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.TextureTarget target, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.TextureParameterName pname, int32 param) cil managed

param.name: target
param.para: Specifies the target texture, which must be either GL_TEXTURE_1D, GL_TEXTURE_2D, GL_TEXTURE_3D, GL_TEXTURE_1D_ARRAY, GL_TEXTURE_2D_ARRAY, GL_TEXTURE_RECTANGLE, or GL_TEXTURE_CUBE_MAP.

param.name: pname
param.para: Specifies the symbolic name of a single-valued texture parameter. pname can be one of the following: GL_TEXTURE_BASE_LEVEL, GL_TEXTURE_COMPARE_FUNC, GL_TEXTURE_COMPARE_MODE, GL_TEXTURE_LOD_BIAS, GL_TEXTURE_MIN_FILTER, GL_TEXTURE_MAG_FILTER, GL_TEXTURE_MIN_LOD, GL_TEXTURE_MAX_LOD, GL_TEXTURE_MAX_LEVEL, GL_TEXTURE_SWIZZLE_R, GL_TEXTURE_SWIZZLE_G, GL_TEXTURE_SWIZZLE_B, GL_TEXTURE_SWIZZLE_A, GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_S, GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_T, or GL_TEXTURE_WRAP_R.

param.name: param
param.para: Specifies the value of pname.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void VertexAttribPointer (int index, int size, MonoMac.OpenGL.VertexAttribPointerType type, bool normalized, int stride, IntPtr pointer);
.method public static hidebysig void VertexAttribPointer(int32 index, int32 size, valuetype MonoMac.OpenGL.VertexAttribPointerType type, bool normalized, int32 stride, native int pointer) cil managed

param.name: index
param.para: Specifies the index of the generic vertex attribute to be modified.

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the number of components per generic vertex attribute. Must be 1, 2, 3, 4. Additionally, the symbolic constant GL_BGRA is accepted by glVertexAttribPointer. The initial value is 4.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each component in the array. The symbolic constants GL_BYTE, GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, GL_SHORT, GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT, GL_INT, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT are accepted by both functions. Additionally GL_HALF_FLOAT, GL_FLOAT, GL_DOUBLE, GL_FIXED, GL_INT_2_10_10_10_REV, and GL_UNSIGNED_INT_2_10_10_10_REV are accepted by glVertexAttribPointer. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: normalized
param.para: For glVertexAttribPointer, specifies whether fixed-point data values should be normalized (GL_TRUE) or converted directly as fixed-point values (GL_FALSE) when they are accessed.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive generic vertex attributes. If stride is 0, the generic vertex attributes are understood to be tightly packed in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a offset of the first component of the first generic vertex attribute in the array in the data store of the buffer currently bound to the GL_ARRAY_BUFFER target. The initial value is 0.

Docs.summary: [requires: v2.0] Define an array of generic vertex attribute data

param.name: size
param.para: Specifies the number of coordinates per vertex. Must be 2, 3, or 4. The initial value is 4.

param.name: type
param.para: Specifies the data type of each coordinate in the array. Symbolic constants GL_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, or GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive vertices. If stride is 0, the vertices are understood to be tightly packed in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first coordinate of the first vertex in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.para: Specifies the data type of each coordinate in the array. Symbolic constants GL_SHORT, GL_INT, GL_FLOAT, or GL_DOUBLE are accepted. The initial value is GL_FLOAT.

param.name: stride
param.para: Specifies the byte offset between consecutive vertices. If stride is 0, the vertices are understood to be tightly packed in the array. The initial value is 0.

param.name: pointer
param.para: Specifies a pointer to the first coordinate of the first vertex in the array. The initial value is 0.

Docs.summary: [requires: v1.1][deprecated: v3.1] Define an array of vertex data
